channel.title: Stealing
channel.description: Why is theft in the real word considered drastically worse than in the virtual world? for example i know a policeman, he is fairly high up in the police, and yet he has no qualms about the fact that me or his son download music, programs etc for free. Yet when he found out bout my sister(for those of you who dont know she got caught being a thief) he found it insulting to have known her and lets face so do i. But i dont understand why theft of programs over the internet costing serious amounts of cash are considered trivial against someone who just steals from a shop. Anyone know?

item.title: Stealing
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

[quote=“Yz85Racer, post:32, topic:256499”][quote author=Ske link=topic=338789.msg2628783#msg2628783 date=1231986397]

Why is theft in the real word considered drastically worse than in the virtual world? for example i know a policeman, he is fairly high up in the police, and yet he has no qualms about the fact that me or his son download music, programs etc for free. Yet when he found out bout my sister(for those of you who dont know she got caught being a thief) he found it insulting to have known her and lets face so do i. But i dont understand why theft of programs over the internet costing serious amounts of cash are considered trivial against someone who just steals from a shop. Anyone know?

wow you have no respect for your sister at all.
How can you find it insulting to know your sister?
And why the fuck would you let another person tell such a thing about someone of your family?(especially a fucking cop??)

Damn kids these days, always thinking with someone else’s brain.

on-topic: oh wow she stole oh no lets cry and say bad things about our family on a forum so we might get some respect from the respected guys cause im such a low life i have nothing better to do than talk shit about my family oh nooo

[/quote]
…I think you should just stop posting.[/quote]
agreed.
Why do i find it a shame? because she was caught stealing, thats just like a slap across the face for family etc sif we didnt raise her right but its coz she hangs around with bloody wiggers

most signs are images so no need for reading

item.title: Stealing
item.dc:creator: @Exception1 Exception_
item.description:
@Exception1 wrote:

Mopman:

It’s not the same. If I link you to a page called “help with port forwarding” and it has an image on it of a child naked, you downloaded that image. Is it your fault?

I agree, it’s not. But sanga is trying to stir up everything so we all get confused and start picking at each others non-related ‘wrong’ points.

sanga282:

even if the link you downloaded from said ‘HAXED PIRATE COPY’? you could just deny that you didnt know

No more needs to be said…

Now to continue the point about it being illegal to share files without knowing on limewire or torrents. Ignorance does not stand in a court of law, you cannot just simply say ‘I did not know’ in your defence (unless of course, you tried to steal the moparscape webclient and got sent to page showing a rotating penis). When you download the sharing software it’s in their agreement that the stuff you download is shared with other users, and it’s your responsibility to read that. I hate to keep using analogies, but it’s like signing a contract then breaking it because you didn’t read some of it.

And anyway, how is anyone going to accidentally download pirated software, accidentally use it and burn it to disc, and accidentally share it, even if the link does say Dead Baby Jokes @@ Deluxe Boxset?

Read full topic

item.title: Stealing
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

There’s no mens rea in a case like mopman described, so you couldn’t get charged. You’re expected to know the speed limits in your municipality and highways have signs. Disobeying them is being reckless and there’s your mens rea.

Read full topic

item.title: Stealing
item.dc:creator: @IdidntInhale IdidntInhale
item.description:
@IdidntInhale wrote:

[quote=“Exception_, post:19, topic:256499”][quote author=IdidntInhale link=topic=338789.msg2628293#msg2628293 date=1231960693]

The authorities cannot prove you knew what it was when you were downloading it, someone could’ve posted a link saying “my mom playing the piano”, however if you branch into the sharing industry i.e. uploading, then you are fucked.

even if the link you downloaded from said ‘HAXED PIRATE COPY’? you could just deny that you didnt know

k then, police officer pulls you over for driving above the speed limit. You tell him you didn’t know what the speed limit was, so he lets you off. Nope, lol. People also get done for unknowingly sharing files using torrents, limewire etc.

You, are an idiot.
[/quote]

Care to expand on that?[/quote]

If the filename were something such as “my mom playing the piano” or something of the like, not implying that it was a music file of which you downloaded, then you could in fact claim you did not know, just like if the sign that says the speed limit is gone, or unable to be read, you could claim you did not know the speed limit.

Read full topic

item.description:

@Exception_: Still a crime. That’s like manslaughter instead of murder.

item.description:

k then, police officer pulls you over for driving above the speed limit. You tell him you didn’t know what the speed limit was, so he lets you off. Nope, lol. People also get done for unknowingly sharing files using torrents, limewire etc.[/quote]

There are laws, and you can see a sign. You are supposed to see that sign, you have been taught to. With that sign comes a few laws. You are supposed to know the law. With downloading it’s different. The signs aren’t placed by the authorities, so they aren’t that bonding.

Read full topic

item.title: Stealing
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

Stealing in the digital world isn’t as bad because you don’t steal something physical, or not something that can become physical. So hacking someones bank account is just as bad as stealing someones money, because the money on your bank account can be made physical. But other then money, digital stuff can’t be made physical.

You type a poem on your laptop, and someone hacks you and copy’s your poem. You don’t lose anything. You still have the poem, but now someone else has it too.

The same applies to you writing down a poem on paper. Someone comes into your office, and writes your poem on another piece of paper that he brought with him, with a pen of his own (just to make sure he won’t be accused of stealing some ink or a piece of paper). You don’t lose anything.

It’s called copyright infringement.

Read full topic

item.title: Stealing
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

[quote=“Exception_, post:12, topic:256499”]I mean publically uploading, not just transferring. They’d be pretty stupid to do that anyway, memory sticks ftw. You aren’t actually allowed to copy the data at all in most software packages, people just do it personally because nobody will find out and it doesn’t harm anyone. Uploading and seeding torrents however, is.

I don’t even know whose side you’re on anymore anyway :’([/quote]
i was just playing the devil’s advocate

Read full topic

item.title: Stealing
item.dc:creator: @PeterMan PeterMan
item.description:
@PeterMan wrote:

[quote=“sanga282, post:10, topic:256499”][quote author=Exception_ link=topic=338789.msg2628139#msg2628139 date=1231950530]

Because downloading music and programs is NOT theft.

Theft = removes the original.

technically piracy is still theft

How?

In criminal law, theft (also known as stealing or filching) is the illegal taking of another person’s property without that person’s freely-given consent.

What property have I taken? And if you say Intellectual Property, you get a rusty spoon up the anal cavity.

is that a threat or a promise
you are taking the files without permission from the company, they sell it to a sole person to use. If that person copys the file onwards you are taking the organization’s property without their consent
just for the rusty spoon: intellectual property

It’s illegal, yes. But harder to enforce and nowhere near as bad as physically stealing. The people who should be spanked are the few who upload the stuff in the first place.
[/quote]
not necessarily they might be uploading for themselves if they need it at a different location, you downloading it is your fault completely not theirs[/quote]
Yeah, but the people that upload copyrighted files are the one that will get punished if caught.

Read full topic
